rev.comment: combine 2006 product additions into one area, rephrase.
rev.diff:
Line 65: Line 65:
[[Google Desktop]] is a service that brings the search engine to the local computer desktop, allowing one to search individual files, folders, and emails that reside locally on one's own PC.
[[Google Desktop]] is a service that brings the search engine to the local computer desktop, allowing one to search individual files, folders, and emails that reside locally on one's own PC.
â
[[March]], [[2006]], saw the dawn of [[Google Page Creator]], an easy to use, [[WYSIWYG]] webpage creator. The domains are currently limited only to individuals with a [[Gmail]] account, and the users individual pages reside at http://''username''.googlepages.com.
+
[[2006]] saw the dawn of [[Google Page Creator]] (an easy to use, [[WYSIWYG]] webpage creator), as well as [[Google Calendar]] (a shared-calendaring application), and Google Apps for Your Domain, which combined [[Gmail]], [[Google Calendar]], [[Google Talk]], and [[Google Page Creator]] into a single offering targeted to small businesses and educational institutions.<ref>Needleman, Rafe. "[http://reviews.zdnet.co.uk/0,39023100,39281962,00.htm Google Apps for Your Domain]." ''[[ZDNet]].'' [[August 29]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[August 31]], [[2006]].</ref>
â   â
In [[April]], [[2006]], Google launched [[Google Calendar]], a shared calendar application.
  â   â
In [[August]], [[2006]], the Google Apps for Your Domain service was launched, combining [[Gmail]], [[Google Calendar]], [[Google Talk]], and [[Google Page Creator]] into a single offering targeted to small businesses and educational institutions.<ref>Needleman, Rafe. "[http://reviews.zdnet.co.uk/0,39023100,39281962,00.htm Google Apps for Your Domain]." ''[[ZDNet]].'' [[August 29]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[August 31]], [[2006]].</ref>
